Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for analytics, data modeling, and reporting. Identify the data sources and business use cases for Azure Analysis Services.
Design the data model to be implemented in Azure Analysis Services, including dimensions, measures, hierarchies, and relationships.
Create and configure an Azure Analysis Services instance in the Azure portal, selecting the appropriate tier and region.
Set up role-based access control (RBAC) and define user permissions for accessing the Azure Analysis Services instance.
Integrate Azure Analysis Services with data sources such as Azure SQL Database, Azure Synapse Analytics, or on-premises databases.
Deploy the designed data model to the Azure Analysis Services instance using tools like SQL Server Data Tools (SSDT) or Tabular Editor.
Enable encryption for data at rest and in transit to ensure the security of sensitive information.
Configure monitoring and alerting for the Azure Analysis Services instance using Azure Monitor to track performance and usage metrics.
Perform testing to validate the analytics solution, including data accuracy, performance, and user access.
Implement performance optimization techniques such as partitioning, aggregations, and query tuning.
Create detailed documentation of the solution architecture, including data sources, data model, security settings, and monitoring configurations.
Conduct training sessions for end-users and administrators on how to use and manage the Azure Analysis Services solution.

Tasks.Task: Implement Backup and Disaster Recovery Plan
Tasks.Task Description: Set up a backup and disaster recovery plan to ensure data and service availability in case of failures.

Tasks.Task: Perform Regular Audits and Compliance Checks
Tasks.Task Description: Conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with organizational and regulatory requirements.
Use Azure Monitor to continuously track the health and performance of Azure Analysis Services servers. Identify and resolve any anomalies or issues.
Regularly back up model data to ensure data recovery in case of unexpected failures. Store backups securely in Azure Blob Storage or other secure locations.
Review and update security policies, including role-based access control (RBAC) and firewall settings, to ensure compliance with organizational security standards.
Conduct regular audits of user access permissions to ensure only authorized users have access to Azure Analysis Services resources.
Monitor resource usage and scale Azure Analysis Services instances up or down based on demand to optimize cost and performance.
Perform regular tests of the disaster recovery plan to ensure the ability to restore services and data in case of a major outage.
Analyze query performance logs to identify slow-running queries and optimize them for better performance.
Regularly apply updates and patches to Azure Analysis Services to ensure the service is running on the latest version and is secure.
Perform incident response drills to prepare the team for potential security incidents or service outages. Ensure familiarity with procedures and protocols.
Ensure that data refresh processes are running as expected and troubleshoot any issues with data synchronization.
Evaluate the service's adherence to SLA metrics and address any deviations or issues with Azure support.
Ensure the operations team participates in regular training to stay updated with new Azure Analysis Services features, best practices, and security measures.
